infotexts.spw_openmenuhelp: Opens the Soundproof Walls settings menu.
infotexts.spw_syncsettingsalert: Note: This server has syncing enabled - all players will automatically use the host's settings (values in parentheses)
infotexts.spw_enabledtooltip: Toggles all functionality of the mod
infotexts.spw_effectprocessingmodetooltip: How Soundproof Walls processes audio effects. Each mode has unique pros and cons which can dramatically change the experience (adjusting this setting while playing will briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded/unloaded)
infotexts.spw_vanillafxtooltip:
This is classic Soundproof Walls. Modifies the muffle buffer provided by the vanilla game.
Pros:
• Zero performance considerations

Cons:
• Only one muffle frequency (creates a very on/off feel)
• No reverb support
infotexts.spw_staticfxtooltip:
Adds two new muffle presets (light and medium) and reverb for certain sounds by creating additional buffers.
Pros:
• Three total muffle frequencies allow for more nuanced audio
• Reverb support for non-looping sounds

Cons:
• Longer loading times (~2s) and more memory usage (~250MB)
•Potential for instability with other sound-based Lua/C# mods (extremely unlikely)
infotexts.spw_dynamicfxtooltip:
Highly recommended. Uses the OpenAL Effects Extension to simulate advanced audio effects in real-time.
Pros:
• Effectively unlimited muffle frequencies for more variety
• Muffle strength is determined by advanced factors such as the number of surfaces the sound travelled through
• Significantly less audio pops and crackles
• Sounds are heard from the direction they came from instead of just their origin point, and can appear to come from multiple directions based on the environment.

Cons:
• Higher CPU load which may impact performance
infotexts.spw_syncsettingstooltip: Requires server-side Lua to be running.\nSynchronizes the host/admin's local config file with all players connected to the server (this is achieved by creating a separate config held server-side for players' to inherit. This setting does not modify any local config files)
infotexts.spw_talkingragdollstooltip: Hear players speak when they are ragdolled as long as they're not stunned
infotexts.spw_focustargetaudiotooltip: Simulate audio from the POV of the current target (i.e., you hear what the turret/camera hears)
infotexts.spw_heavylowpassfrequencytooltip: Used by the "Classic" and "Static" effect processing modes.\nThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are heavily obstructed by walls or water (adjusting this setting mid-round will briefly freeze the game as new buffers are loaded)
infotexts.spw_mediumlowpassfrequencytooltip: Used by the "Static" effect processing mode.\nThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds/voices that are mildly obstructed when propagating through walls or heard via eavesdropping (adjusting this setting mid-round will briefly freeze the game as new buffers are loaded)
infotexts.spw_lightlowpassfrequencytooltip: Used by the "Static" effect processing mode.\nThe corner frequency used to muffle sounds/voices that are slightly obstructed by diving suits or heard in other structures via hydrophones (adjusting this setting mid-round will briefly freeze the game as new buffers are loaded)
infotexts.spw_soundrangetooltip: Range multiplier for non-looping sounds. Stacks with the per-sound range multiplier given in the Custom Sounds list
infotexts.spw_loopingsoundrangetooltip: Range multiplier for looping sounds. Stacks with the per-sound range multiplier given in the Custom Sounds list
infotexts.spw_soundpropagationrangetooltip: The maximum distance that a sound in the "Wall Propagating Sounds" list can search for a nearby hull to propagate into
infotexts.spw_voicelowpassfrequencytooltip: The corner frequency used to muffle player voices that are heavily obstructed by walls or water. If a voice is not heavily obstructed, the standard light or medium slider will be used instead
infotexts.spw_radiobandpassfrequencytooltip: The center frequency of the bandpass filter. The frequencies in this area (the size of which is controlled by the Q factor setting below) are allowed to pass through the radio
infotexts.spw_radiobandpassqualityfactortooltip: The quality factor of the radio bandpass filter. Defines how tight the filter is around its center frequency. A higher value creates a more "intense" effect
infotexts.spw_radiodistortiontooltip: The amount of distortion applied to player voices over the radio
infotexts.spw_radiostatictooltip: The amount of static heard over the radio
infotexts.spw_muffledivingsuittooltip: Requires "Extended Sounds" to be enabled.\nToggles the slight muffling of sounds when wearing a diving suit
infotexts.spw_muffleeavesdroppingtolltip: Requires "Extended Sounds" to be enabled.\nSounds heard through surfaces via eavesdropping are slightly muffled
infotexts.spw_mufflesubmergedplayertooltip: Muffle audio when your head is underwater (recommended)
infotexts.spw_mufflesubmergedviewtargettooltip: Muffle audio when your viewed target is underwater (e.g., turrets, cameras, etc)
infotexts.spw_mufflesubmergedsoundstooltip: Muffle sounds that traverse an air-water barrier (recommended)
infotexts.spw_muffleflowsoundstooltip: Toggle the muffling of water flow sounds from leaks when the player is submerged, eavesdropping, or using hydrophones
infotexts.spw_mufflefiresoundstooltip: Toggle the muffling of fire sounds
infotexts.spw_sidechainingtooltip: Briefly ducks the volume of all sounds when a sound in the "Custom Sounds" list with a "SidechainMultiplier" greater than zero is played
infotexts.spw_sidechainintensitymastertooltip: A multiplier applied to all sidechain multipliers in the "Custom Sounds" list
infotexts.spw_sidechainreleasemastertooltip: A flat amount of time added to all releases in the "Custom Sounds" list
infotexts.spw_sidechainreleasecurvetooltip: The exponent used to calculate the shape of the sidechain release curve. Values below one start slowly and decay more sharply towards the end. Values above one drop quickly and flatten out towards the end
infotexts.spw_muffledvoicevolumetooltip: Volume of lowpassed player voices behind a wall/water surface
infotexts.spw_muffledsoundvolumetooltip: Volume of lowpassed non-looping sounds behind a wall/water surface
infotexts.spw_muffledcomponentvolumetooltip: Volume of lowpassed looping component/status effect sounds behind a wall/water surface
infotexts.spw_submergedvolumetooltip: The volume of submerged sounds when the listener is also submerged in the same body of water
infotexts.spw_flowsoundvolumetooltip: The volume of flowing water caused by leaks in the submarine
infotexts.spw_eavesdroppingenabledtooltip: Toggles the player's ability to eavesdrop
infotexts.spw_eavesdroppingfadetooltip: Smoothly transition audio between hulls when eavesdropping
infotexts.spw_eavesdroppingfadedurationtooltip: The amount of seconds that the eavesdropping fade transition takes
infotexts.spw_eavesdroppingthresholdtooltip: The percentage of the fade transition that must play before the player starts hearing sounds on the opposite side of the door
infotexts.spw_eavesdroppingmaxdistancetooltip: The maximum distance the player's head can be from a door while eavesdropping
infotexts.spw_hydrophoneswitchenabledtooltip: Toggles the existence of the hydrophone switch (requires restarting the round)
infotexts.spw_hydrophonelegacyswitchtooltip: Use the old hydrophone switch logic (switch is turned off when using active sonar)
infotexts.spw_hydrophonerangetooltip: The range of underwater movement sounds and the additional range added to all sounds outside the submarine
infotexts.spw_waterambiencetransitionspeedtooltip: The speed at which the water ambience transitions between volume presets
infotexts.spw_divingsuitpitchtooltip: The pitch of sounds when wearing a diving suit (stacks additively with other pitch effects)
infotexts.spw_submergedpitchtooltip: The pitch of sounds when the listener is submerged (stacks additively with other pitch effects)
infotexts.spw_muffledsoundpitchtooltip: The strength of the distance-based pitch shifting effect for havily muffled sounds (does not apply to looping sounds).
infotexts.spw_muffledcomponentpitchtooltip: The pitch of muffled looping sounds (e.g. vents, reactor, engine, etc)
infotexts.spw_unmuffledcomponentpitchtooltip: The pitch of normal component sounds. Not recommended. Just for fun
infotexts.spw_customsoundstooltip: Tweak the volume of any vanilla or modded sounds. Providing a sidechain multiplier above zero will mark the sound(s) for sidechaining, lowering the volume of other sounds by the amount specified (a value of 1 is equal to a 100% volume reduction). The release value controls how many seconds it takes for the sidechain multiplier to decay to back to zero after the sound plays. Sounds in the exclusion list are ignored, allowing for more selective group targeting.
infotexts.spw_hidesettingstooltip: Warning: Enabling this setting will remove the "Soundproof Settings" button from your UI. Requiring you to type "spw" in the console to open it again.
infotexts.spw_updateserverconfig: modified settings - the server config has been updated
infotexts.spw_disableserverconfig: disabled setting synchronization - local configs now take priority
